content: sample uses likely already know what gauge needle lang yarns jawoll superwash 50g = and stitch count works best for you 210m/230yds i recommend you stick to that and pick the size closest to your usual stitch count notions cable needle darning needle if you want to use a custom stitch count scissors stitch markers make sure to align the cable chart so that they re on the outer edge of your foot and don t interfere with the heel feel free to change the cast on cuff heel and toe to your liking 2 pattern by wildflower fibercrafts awildflowerslife blog cuff leg cast on 56/64/72 stitches using the long you can find the cable chart as well as the tail cast on method written-out instructions for the chart in the back of this pattern join to knit in the round left sock in order for the cable section to start on small k 38 work main cable chart similar points under the ribbing despite the medium k 46 work main cable chart placement of the cable section differing large k 54 work main cable chart between both socks the ribbing needs to be flipped accordingly right sock small k 28 work main cable chart k to ribbing left sock k2 p2 to the end of the end of the round the round medium k 32 work main cable chart k to the end of the round ribbing right sock p2 k2 to the end large k 36 work main cable chart k to of the round the end of the round knit this ribbing for a total of 15 rounds keep knitting like this till you ve reached or till you ve reached your desired length your desired length the sample has 3 full main cable chart repeats on the leg 36 rounds in total 3 pattern by wildflower fibercrafts awildflowerslife blog heel flap the heel flap is worked in row back and forth over half of your total stitches your first 28/32/36 stitches of the round row 1 slip 1 wyb k1 to the end of the row turn row 2 slip 1 wyf p to the end of the row the gaps will look like this turn the unworked stitches will now be work row 1&2 a total of 14/16/18 times incorporated over the next few row by you ll have completed a total of 28/32/36 decreasing over these gaps this is done as row follows heel turn the gaps will look like this setup row 1 sl1 wyb k to 1 stitch before the row 1 sl1 wyb k14/16/18 ssk k1 gap ssk k1 turn turn row 2 sl1 wyf p to 1 stitch before the rowe 2 sl1 wyf p3 p2tog p1 turn gap p2tog p1 turn this creates a little gap between the last repeat row 1&2 till you have 2 unworked stitch you worked and the ones left stitches after the gap on either side of your unworked needle 4 pattern by wildflower
